subject: Marketing
title: The First TV Commercial
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The First TV Commercial.

hook.text: On July 1, 1941, a Bulova watch ad aired before a baseball game. It cost $9. It lasted 10 seconds.

buildup.text: Television combined sight, sound, and motion. Advertising would never be the same.

discovery.text: TV made brands feel alive. You could see the product, watch it work, and feel its world.

twist.text: Within a decade, TV ad spending surpassed all other media combined.

climax.text: That $9 experiment started a trillion-dollar industry built on moving pictures.

punchline.text: Ten seconds changed a century of advertising.

quiz.question: What was the first television commercial?
options: A 10-second Bulova watch ad before a baseball game in 1941
A Coca-Cola ad during the 1950 Super Bowl
